article.Heading: Budget 2017: I-T officials get more teeth track tax evaders
article.Summary: This Budget has also given authority to more income tax officials to exercise their power in case of any inquiry or probe, "without seeking prior approval of higher authorities".
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

The government on Wednesday said income tax officials will now have greater authority to track down tax evaders, in its attempt to clamp down on black money.

An official from income tax department may carry out "search and seizure", if he has "reason to believe" or "reason to suspect", according to budget document for 2017-18.

The government, in addition, has widened the scope of tax authorities' power to survey, any place, including, where any charitable activity is being carried on.

"The existing provisions empower an income-tax authority to enter any place, at which a business or profession is carried on...for the purposes of conducting a survey. It is proposed...to include any place, at which an activity for charitable purpose is carried on," the government said.

This change will come into effect from April 1, 2017.

This Budget has also given authority to more income tax officials to exercise their power in case of any inquiry or probe, "without seeking prior approval of higher authorities".

From April 1, a joint director, deputy director and assistant director can conduct inquiries, even without the prior approval senior officials such as the Principal Director or Director or the Principal Commissioner.

In addition, the government has empowered the Central Board of Direct Taxes to issue notice asking information and documents required for verification of tax payer's information in its possession.
